section.name: PortletBridge
section.p: The Portlet Bridge Portlet is a web clipping proxy portlet that allows web application be hosted as portlets. See the PortletBridge Portlet project for more information. The portlet bridge portlet makes downstream HTTP calls and uses CyberNeko and XSLT to do the web clipping.

tr.td: PortletBridge Portlet 1.1 Final has been released!
PortletBridge Portlet 1.1-rc2 has been released. Features include: Upgrade to neko 0.9.5, Parser feature and property support and stylesheetUrl preference support.
PortletBridge Portlet 1.1-rc1 has been released. Features include: Base URL support, initial configurable authenticator support and various bug fixes.
PortletBridge Portlet 1.1-beta3 has been released. Features include: Better integration with Gridsphere 2.1.1, configurable request id's to avoid clashes and is compiled with Java 1.4.2.

PortletBridge Portlet 1.1-beta2 has been released. New features include: rewriting of remote css and javascript; configurable regular expressions for css and javascript; upgrade to httpclient rc4; and numerous bug fixes.
PortletBridge Portlet 1.0 has been released. If you find it useful please let me know by mail at dkfn at users.sourceforge.net. Same goes for any bugs, enhancement requests etc.

PortletBridge Portlet beta 1 has been released. While there are still a few todo's, the PortletBridge portlet is essentially feature complete for 1.0. That said, if there are any features you'd like to see in the portlet, please let me know by mail at dkfn at users.sourceforge.net.

section.p: Portlet Bridge requires Java 1.4 or above.
